title: Java Access Modifiers
subject: Java
theory:
Access modifiers specify accessibility (scope) of a data member, method, constructor, or class.

1.  **private**: Within class only.
2.  **default** (no keyword): Within package.
3.  **protected**: Package + Subclasses (outside package).
4.  **public**: Everywhere.

common_mistakes.correction: Protected is remarkably open (visible to whole package), unlike private.

interview_questions.question: Can a top-level Class be private?
interview_questions.answer: No. Top level classes can only be public or default.

practice_problems.hint: Make it private, provide public getter.

real_world_use_cases.description: Library authors make internal helper classes 'default' so users can't see/use them.

exam_notes: Order of visibility: private < default < protected < public.
